cont.entity_a: Comfortable for large hands and frequent use.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable with wrist brace. Comfortable grip but stiff cable in wired version. Comfortable for casual use but not gaming.

Ergonomics.comm: Ergonomic design helps with wrist pain.

cont.entity_a: Helps alleviate wrist pain with proper hand positioning. Ergonomic design allows natural hand rest. Ergonomic design requires a learning curve but is effective. Ergonomic design reduces wrist pain effectively.
cont.entity_b: Ergonomic mouse comfortable with wrist brace. Ergonomic grip reduces wrist pain but requires adaptation. Ergonomic design beneficial but lacks trackpad. Ergonomic design helps with 'mouse elbow' problem. Ergonomic design improves hand comfort.

cont.entity_a: Heavy with two batteries; can use one to reduce weight. Wireless version has a large, inconvenient receiver. Requires adjustment period for ergonomic design.
cont.entity_b: Cheap plastic and fragile thumb-buttons. Materials have been cheapened over time. Vertical design overpriced and poorly constructed. Design flaw with single thumb button.
Mouse deteriorates after a year of use.

cont.entity_a: No on/off switch or rechargeable batteries. Wireless mouse has a short range and consumes batteries quickly.
Accurate for Photoshop work. Top center buttons are for magnification and page back. Great sensitivity and customizable buttons.
cont.entity_b: Works only on pants leg surface. No scroll wheel, affecting usability. Mouse speed too fast and not adjustable. Inaccurate and jerky tracking.

Wireless.comm: Wireless version has a large receiver.

cont.entity_a: Short wireless range affects usability. Wireless mouse requires line of sight for best performance.
cont.entity_b: Poor wireless performance, prefers wired version.

cont.entity_a: Not built for small hands, causing strain in the index finger. Large size suits larger hands, not ideal for small hands.
cont.entity_b: Uncomfortable for arthritis sufferers due to small grip. Uncomfortable for large hands.

cont.entity_a: Ergonomic design helps with wrist and elbow pain.
cont.entity_b: Helps relieve pain from hand injury. Significant pain relief for carpal tunnel sufferers.

cont.entity_a: Mouse wheel is slow and overly resistive. Scroll wheel is hard to click and spin.
cont.entity_b: Scroll function not effective on all applications. Thumb clicking requires adaptation.

cont.entity_a: Good customer service for defective unit replacement. Defective units replaced with a restocking fee.

cont.entity_b: Not Windows 10 compatible. Reduces wrist stress but not compatible with Mac.
